Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.processing

Non-blocking, Atomic and Thread-bound Message Processors

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MessageProcessor
    The MessageProcessor interface identifies the processing methods that can be used by applications.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AtomicInbox
    The inbox used by AtomicMessageProcessor, the next request is not made available for processing until a result is assigned to the previous request.
    AtomicMessageProcessor
    A message processor which processes each request to completion, and which should be used by actors which perform long computations, I/O, or otherwise block the thread.
    Inbox
    Provides at least two queues for a message processor's incoming messages, where the first queue is a concurrent linked queue for messages passed from other message processors and the other(s) are local queues for messages that are passed using the message processor's own thread.
    MessageProcessorBase
    Base class for message processors.
    NonBlockingInbox
    The inbox used by NonBlockingMessageProcessor and ThreadBoundMessageProcessor, NonBlockingInbox uses an ArrayDeque for the local queue.
    NonBlockingMessageProcessor
    A message processor for actors which process messages quickly and without blocking the thread.
    Outbox
    An outbox holds a collection of send buffers.
    ThreadBoundMessageProcessor
    A mailbox processor bound to a pre-existing thread, a thread-bound mailbox processor can use a program's main thread or a GUI thread.
    UnboundMessageProcessor
    Common code for NonBlockingMessageProcessor and AtomicMessageProcessor, which are not bound to a thread.

Package org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.processing Description

Non-blocking, Atomic and Thread-bound Message Processors

While MessageProcessors are used by the Event and Request classes to pass messages and process messages, the MessageProcessor interface itself include only a few methods for use by application developers.

Creating a MessageProcessor

Actors can use 3 different classes of message processors: NonBlockingMessageProcessor, AtomicMessageProcessor and ThreadBoundMessageProcessor. MessageProcessor instances are easily created, with an instance of JAContext as a required parameter. Additional parameters can be also bepassed to the constructor for configuring a message processor:

  • int initialBufferSize This is the initial size of the the send buffers used by the outbox. When not provided, JAContext.getInitialBufferSize() is used instead.
  • int initialLocalQueueSize The initial size of the locl queueeque(s) used by the inbox. When not provided, JAContext.getInitialLocalMessageQueueSize() is used instead.
  • Runnable onIdle The onIdle.run method is called when the inbox becomes empty. (This parameter does not apply to ThreadBoundMessageProcessor.)
  • Runnable boundProcessor The boundProcessor.run method is called when a thread-bound processor has messages that need processing. As a result of invoking the boundProcessor.run method, the ThreadBoundMessageProcessor.run method be invoked in turn by the thread that the processing is bound to. (This parameter does not apply to NonBlockingMessageProcessor nor to AtomicMessageProcessor.)
